sentences: Ostin uuden puhelimen, joka on toiminut hyvin.
Tässä on mies, joka sen teki.
context: The Finnish word 'joka' is a relative pronoun meaning 'who', 'which', or 'that'. It refers to the previous word or phrase. It can also mean 'every' when used as a determiner, for example in 'joka päivä' (every day). The form of the word changes depending on its case; it has a complex declension with multiple forms for singular and plural.
